releases.details: Released as part of the Mannequin Mania box set along with a special edition of Spearhead from Space.
special_features: Commentary by Katy Manning, Nicholas Courtney, and Producer/Director Barry Letts
Life on Earth - Actors recount the production
The Doctor's Moriarty - A look at the Master
Plastic Fantastic - Writers’ take on plastic's role in the story

notes: This story marks the first appearance of Jo Grant as the Doctor's companion.
Roger Delgado's portrayal of the Master established him as the Doctor's archenemy.
The plot features the Autons, reintroduced since their last appearance in season 7.

in_universe_mythology: The Master is a renegade Time Lord.
Autons are plastic creatures controlled by the Nestene Consciousness.

continuity_notes: The story is set in the fictional town of Tarminster.
The Nestene Consciousness and Autons appeared previously in Spearhead from Space.

plot.plot_summary: The Master attempts to conquer Earth by reactivating a dormant Nestene energy unit, utilizing it to control Auton creations which pose a deadly threat to humanity. The Third Doctor, alongside his new companion Jo Grant, must stop the Master's plans and save Earth from the advancing army of Autons.

In a circus, the Master hypnotizes key individuals to further his aim while Jo attempts to prove her worth, leading to near catastrophic encounters as the Doctor and Jo confront a series of deadly Auton attacks.
The Doctor and Jo team up with the Brigadier to fend off a series of Auton assaults while uncovering the Master's true plan, leading to a climactic confrontation at a radio telescope.
The Doctor and Jo, now captured by the Master, must escape and prevent the triggering of a signal that would unleash the Nestene invasion, ultimately reversing the danger back into space.
